attractions.name: Freedom Trail
attractions.description: A 2.5-mile-long path through downtown Boston that passes by 16 locations significant to the history of the United States.

attractions.name: Faneuil Hall Marketplace
attractions.description: A historic market complex and meeting hall, now featuring shops, restaurants, and street performances.

attractions.name: New England Aquarium
attractions.description: Home to thousands of aquatic animals, featuring a giant ocean tank and IMAX theatre.

attractions.name: Boston Public Garden
attractions.description: America's first public botanical garden, famous for its Swan Boats and 'Make Way for Ducklings' sculpture.

attractions.name: Museum of Science
attractions.description: A science museum with over 700 interactive exhibits, live presentations, planetarium shows, and an IMAX theater.

attractions.name: Paul Revere House
attractions.description: The colonial home of American patriot Paul Revere, now a national historic landmark and museum.

attractions.name: USS Constitution Museum
attractions.description: A museum dedicated to the history of the USS Constitution, the oldest commissioned warship afloat in the world.

attractions.name: Boston Harbor Cruises
attractions.description: Offers various boat tours including whale watching, harbor islands trips, and historical sightseeing cruises.
